ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Which We have reserved as punishment for evil-doers?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: We have made this tree a trial for the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: which We have made as a torment for the unjust?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: We have indeed made that a punishment for the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Truly, We have made it (as) a trial for the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Surely We have made it to be a trial to the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: We have appointed it as a trial for the evildoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Lo! We have appointed it a torment for wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: which We have made as a test for the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Verily We! We have made it a temptation for the wrong- doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed We have made it a punishment for the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: For We have truly made it (as) a trial for the wrong-doers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Truly We have made it (as) a trail for the Zalimun (polytheists, disbelievers, wrong-doers, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: We have made this (tree) a trial for the evildoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: We made it an ordeal for the unjust.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:63] We have indeed made it, for that reason [sc. its being a tree in the Fire], a trial for the wrongdoers?,   namely, [for] the disbelievers of Mecca, for they said, ‘Fire consumes trees so how can it make them grow forth?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Lo! We have appointed it) We mentioned it as (a torment) a trial (for wrong-doers) Abu Jahl and his host, for they said: the Zaqqum is nothing but dates and butter.
